channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Flashback: When Harry Reid was Right about Immigration
item.description: Thirty years ago, FAIR found what would now be an unlikely ally in The Los Angeles Times opinion page. On August 10, 1994, the late Sen. Harry Reid (D-Nevada) wrote a fantastic op-ed promoting his bill, the Immigration Stabilization Act (S. 1351), to slash legal immigration by two thirds, from approximately 1 million to 325,000 [...] The post Flashback: When Harry Reid was Right about Immigration appeared first on ImmigrationReform.com .

item.title: Harris breaks from ‘Bidenomics’ in North Carolina
item.description: The vice president makes her pitch in North Carolina, where Democrats have long hoped to flip the closely divided state.

item.title: AMD Buys AI Equipment Maker for Nearly $5 Billion, Escalating Battle With Nvidia
item.description: ZT Systems produces servers and other equipment used in data centers for artificial intelligence.

item.title: Election 2024 live updates: Obamas to speak on Day 2 of Democratic National Convention
item.description: Barack and Michelle Obama will speak on Day 2 of the 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago Tuesday.

item.title: New Videos: At NYC’s Roosevelt Hotel, the Migrant Crisis Continues to Rage
item.description: Last week, while in New York City, I decided to take a walk around 10:00 p.m. to see the Roosevelt Hotel, now known as the city’s official migrant welcome center. FAIR visited this same location last year, and you can read our detailed account from that visit here. To read the rest of the article [...] The post New Videos: At NYC’s Roosevelt Hotel, the Migrant Crisis Continues to Rage appeared first on ImmigrationReform.com .

item.title: Harris' economic plan supercharges Biden proposals to fight inflation
item.description: The vice president's plan aims to make housing more affordable, ease health care costs and crack down on corporations for rising grocery prices.

item.title: Sam Altman's Worldcoin Is Battling With Governments Over Your Eyes
item.description: The OpenAI chief’s Worldcoin project involves an attempt to scan the irises of every person on Earth and pay them with his own cryptocurrency. Authorities aren’t buying it.

item.title: Analysis: Ocasio-Cortez’s coming out party
Tren de Aragua Gang Given ‘Green Light’ to Open Fire on U.S. Law Enforcement Officers
item.description: A new report reveals that more than 1,000 members of the violent Venezuelan Tren de Aragua gang have infiltrated the United States and have been given the “green light” to attack and open fire on law enforcement officers. To read the rest of the article click here The post Tren de Aragua Gang Given ‘Green Light’ to Open Fire on U.S. Law Enforcement Officers appeared first on ImmigrationReform.com .

item.title: Trump hits Harris on the economy: 'She destroys everything she touches'
Elon Musk's X to Close Operations in Brazil as Clash Over Content Escalates
item.description: Government threats about how it moderates its platform left the company “no choice,” Musk says.

item.title: Video: The convention’s first night in 60 seconds
Oklahoma Knows You Can’t Manage What You Don’t Measure
item.description: Oklahoma’s Superintendent of the State Department of Education is asking Oklahoma school districts to get a handle on the number of illegal aliens occupying classrooms statewide “to find accurate and effective counting of the cost and burden that illegal immigration has.” To read the rest of the article click here The post Oklahoma Knows You Can’t Manage What You Don’t Measure appeared first on ImmigrationReform.com .

item.title: Everything was going Kamala Harris’ way. Then came the market sell-off.
item.description: "We cannot win if people think we’re headed into a recession," one Democratic National Committee member said.

item.title: How the Sparkles Emoji Became the Symbol of Our AI Future
item.description: Companies including Google, Slack and Spotify picked the same icon for their AI applications, thanks to Silicon Valley’s ‘hive mind.’

item.title: Analysis: Fact-checking Day 1 of the 2024 Democratic National Convention
Massachusetts Migrant Housing Costs: Out of Orbit and Hard to Grasp
item.description: Beyond a certain threshold, numbers become abstract and lose their meaningful context. A quick view of the national debt clock which adds $100,000 of national debt every two-and-a-half seconds to America’s current obligations of $35 trillion is virtually impossible to comprehend. To read the rest of the article click here The post Massachusetts Migrant Housing Costs: Out of Orbit and Hard to Grasp appeared first on ImmigrationReform.com .

item.title: JD Vance at RNC: Trump is the working class' 'last, best hope'
Teens' Energy-Drink Habit Is Amping Anxiety, Disrupting Class and Triggering Seizures
item.description: Young people are staying up late, consuming excess caffeine and crashing during school.

item.title: Barack and Michelle Obama look to add a flavor of 2008 to Harris’s bid
